ARABIC: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ رَبَّكُمُ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكُمْ وَٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَتَّقُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Mankind! worship your Lord, who created you and those before you, so that hopefully you will have taqwa.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So, O you people, adore your Lord who created you, as He did those before you, that you could take heed for yourselves and fear Him
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: O Mankind, submit to your Lord Who created you and those who were before you; in this way only you may expect to save yourselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: People, worship your Lord who created you and those who lived before you, so that you may become pious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: O mankind! Worship your Lord, Who has created you and those before you, in the hope of attaining piety.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: O mankind! Worship your Lord (Allah), Who created you and those who were before you so that you may acquire Taqwa.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: O men! serve your Lord Who created you and those before you so that you may guard (against evil).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: O you men, serve your Lord Who created you, and those that were before you; haply so you will be godfearing;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: O mankind! worship your Lord, Who hath created you and those before you, so that ye may ward off (evil).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: People, worship your Lord, who created you and those before you, so that you may become righteous,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: O Mankind worship your Lord who hath created you and those before you, haply ye may become God-fearing-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: O mankind! Worship your Lord, who created you and those who were before you, so that you may be Godwary
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: O ye people! Adore your Guardian-Lord, who created you and those who came before you, that ye may have the chance to learn righteousness;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: O mankind! Worship your Lord (Allah), Who created you and those who were before you so that you may become Al-Muttaqun (the pious - see V. 2:2).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: O people, worship your Lord who has created you and those who have gone before you, so that you will be cautious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: O people! Worship your Lord who created you and those before you, that you may attain piety.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: O mankind, worship your Lord, who created you and those before you, that you may become righteous -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [2:21] O people, of Mecca, worship, profess the oneness of, your Lord Who created you, made you when you were nothing, and created those that were before you; so that you may be fearful, of His punishment by worshipping Him (la‘alla, ‘so that’, is essentially an optative, but when spoken by God it denotes an affirmative),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (0 mankind!) people of Mecca; and it is also said that this refers to the Jews, (Worship your Lord), declare Him as the only One God, (Who hath created you) as different lineages beginning from a drop of sperm, (and those before you) just as He created those who came before you, (so that ye may ward off) so that you may ward off His wrath and torment and obey Him.
